title: Zed Ulti Balance?
body:
Just a thought here. Everyone is complaining about Zed, Lee Sin, and obviously Sona being way to OP (Kappa).

Zed. Why not make his second Ult activation a reset? This would mean Zed has to kill the target that he uses his Ult on in order to activate the shadow to escape. So if he goes balls deep into a Zhonyas, or Ults a tank to dodge a skill, he can't just get right back out. 
Edit: This wouldn't make his Ult cooldown reset, it would just allow him to step back to his Ult shadow.

Zed's problem seems to be that he has too much kill potential and mobility. This would take at least some of his mobility out and add some counterplay to his kit.

Let me know what you think..

This idea does have potential; however, one major problem is that the mark triggers at precisely the same time the shadow expires. This means that when Zed does get his reset, it will often be too late.

Killing his targets without the extra damage from Death Mark wouldn't be a problem if Zed had the ratios of other assassins, such as Talon. Unfortunately, one major aspect of his kit that most people don't notice is that his damage without his ult detonation is rather sub-par unless he is insanely fed. 
With this change, Zed essentially would never be able to port back with his shadow if he has to kill the target first.

However, I had a similar idea a while ago, which is to allow Zed to only port back after 3 to 4 seconds. He doesn't have to kill the target, but it doesn't allow him to escape from a poor engage immediately either.

The clarification on my idea is in the response to LuckyReden's comment if you want to look, I just typed it. If the shadow would time out before Death Mark's proc, there is always a way to tweak the way the Ult works. I don't know if this fix would just drop in, but altering the spell a little more could make it work.

I like the idea of a timer to port back as well, but I feel like if zed instantly 100-0s someone before that 3-4 seconds, he should be rewarded instead of caught with his pants down. Lol.  I also fee like he should be punished if his sole purpose of ulting is to dodge a skillshot with no intent of killing the target. Just my two cents!

I disagree here. Rengar is an assasin: no way to get out, but still effective. Khazix, Katarina, Akali, Talon: All assissins that either require a kill to get out, or have limited ways to escape after a going in: none of which are "reliable". Yasuo: Requires minions or enemies to give him an escape route after diving into a fight (and yes I still consider him an assassin, personally). 

Why can't Zed be required to KILL the target that he Ults to escape. All this means is that he now needs to keep track of enemy cooldowns before jumping into a fight. I don't see how this makes him different than the other assassins. I feel like an ability named "Death Mark" should be based on the target dying.

Rengar was slightly reworked into a bruiser, i can build full AD Vi and be more successful than Rengar actually.

Death Mark means that it's a technique that works as an execute not how you describe it.

Kha'Zix has stealth.

Katarina is a champion that ALWAYS goes in when she can instantly get a kill and jump from champion to champion to get resets.

Yasuo isn't an assassin but a melee ADC.


Noone of other assassins can be negated lategame by QSS and Zhonya as much as Zed.

The real difference between Zed and other assassins is that his burst is very VARIABLE.

A full rotation of spells of ANY ASSASSIN has a specific amount of damage, only variation is how many items the champion has, which goes for 100% of other champions too.

Zed's ult instead just replicates the damage he's able to deal during the mark.

Death Mark's damage can deal low or high damage depending on many factors, like Shurikens directly hitting a champion since if they go through units the dmg is greatly reduced, exhaust works twice as good against him because if he deals no damage pre-mark detonation his Death Mark will also deal sh!t damage, if you time it correctly you can reduce not only pre mark damage but also when it detonates resulting in a Zed crying quite loudly, another common thing is CC him as soon as he Death Marks someone (But CC generally works with almost everything), now it's even easier to spot since it actually shows a big X on the champion who's being targetted.

My true opinion?

Snowballing, with the dragon changes and junglers not being able to keep up with levels, HP to gank and being a slow clearer overall made snowballing easier.

Any assassin champion that has a power spike at lvl 6 or before can snowball out of control, it's not "Zed", Fizz, Akali, Katarina, Talon, Kha'Zix, Rengar, every single assassin even those who aren't mentioned are gonna snowball if you let them.

Zed is just the scapegoat of the moment, as Rengar, Kha'Zix, Talon and the usual list were before him.

It's just that time of the year again where he, sooner or later gets nerfed because hey, Assassins are broken by design since people can't handle their gameplay.

I don't care if they nerf him, i'll still play him as i've always done, as far as his kit stays more or less the same and i can have fun with him.

I'm not really concerned with the damage of Death Mark. That wasn't the point. The point is that he can instantly get out of any fight at will when there is hardly another champion in the game with that ability. I agree with your snowball point, but Zed was even obnoxious at the end of season 4, when the snowballing dragon and baron minions were put in. If his ratios need to be adjusted to compensate for the escape so that he can kill a little easier, that's fine. But if someone can prevent him from killing them, he shouldn't be able to poof out and try again in 50 seconds - IMO.

Ult has actually 80s cd without CDR, something that Zed doesn't strongly itemize for.

At the end of season4 all i saw were threads about how Zed is balanced and how bruisers are weak and guess what, how mages and adc overlords were dominating.

Because you had just to camp mid for example to let your midlaner transition safely to a point that assassins couldn't deal with them anymore, the same goes with bot.

Yes its 80s without CDR, but if Zed gets brutalizer and Ionan boots, he's already got 30% cdr (assuming he got the 5% from masteries) and that's enough to put his ult's cd at 56s, which means zed can pull of his ult combo every minute, and he doesn't have to worry about running out of Energy because the regen on energy is significantly higher than the regen on mana

He can jump into a fight with no consequence as long as the fight takes place away from his R shadow, he can jump out as he wishes. He needs some downside because as it stands, even if you manage to focus him, he can still kill someone on your team faster and get out.

I never said that this type of change would work in a team fight scenario. It may be used better for cleanup or 1v1s. Zed may be used for Picks or traps. That is exactly the problem with current zed, any situation he is put in, he can perform up to par or better. That's not really fair. He needs a weakness and I can't think of a reasonable weakness that he has right now.

In another comment I said that if it were up to me, Zed and his allies would have something like 0-5 seconds from the Ult cast to kill the target that was Death Marked, If the target dies in that window, he can port back to his ult shadow, otherwise it's strictly used for copying his spells.

His mobility is good, but hardly the best as one is predictable (his ult), it's a targeted ability so he can only use it on a champ.  His shadows are visible for the entirety of their duration so you know the one of two places he's going to be if he is trying to shadow out.

The other thing would be consider lowering the duration of his shadows by a little, give him slightly less window of safety to jump in and out of a fight.

What I was thinking was, the target that Zed Ults has to die. This death can be prior to Death Mark proccing, it can be caused by Death Mark proccing, or it can be a teammate killing the target death mark is on. I supposed it could even be shortly after Death Mark falls off. I figure give zed somewhere between 0-5 seconds to kill the target he Ults. If the target dies in that window, he has the option to jump back to his Ult shadow for somewhere around 3-4 seconds. It's a tradeoff because, as you stated, he can be CC'd/Zhonyas/QSSd, but that's the point. Counterplay.
